intro: Limonium ovalifolium subsp. gallicum, commonly known as the French sea holly, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Europe. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found growing in coastal areas and saline soils. It is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is valued for its ornamental qualities in gardens. Its ability to thrive in harsh environments makes it a resilient and hardy species.
